      • getVisibleRows

        public int getVisibleRows()
        Returns the max of the underlying visible rows of the subcolumns Constantin: function probably incorrect, but impossible to debug because it seems it is not used from anywhere Constantin: case where this function probably fails: column 1: 1/0, column 2: 0/1, return of this function will be probably 1, although the correct result is definitely 2
        Specified by:
        getVisibleRows in class Viewable
        Returns:
        the number of rows actively used on the screen to render this object

        public void detachCells()

      • verticalSplitByCateg_internal

        public static GroupColumn verticalSplitByCateg_internal(CellColumn<? extends CategAmountCell> src,
                                                        java.lang.String category,
                                                        java.util.Set ids,
                                                        boolean generateTotalCols,
                                                        AmpReports reportMetadata)
        Helper method that only uses one category to create a categorized tree. This method is internally used and should not be invoked by the developer directly. this function actually belongs in CellColumn, but leaving it here because it is big and it would screw svn diffs too much
        Parameters:
        src - the CellColumn source
        category - category the category to categorize the data with
        generateTotalCols - true when creating TotalAmountColumnS instead of CellColumnS
        Returns:
        a GroupColumn that holds the categorized Data

      • addColumn

        public void addColumn(Column c)
        Adds a Column to this GroupColumn. The Parent property of the added Column will be set to this GroupColumn. If the column already exists then the items are appended to the column end so we'll end up with one unique column per group
        Parameters:
        c -

        Returns:

      • getRowSpanInHeading_internal

        public int getRowSpanInHeading_internal()
        Description copied from class: Column
        only to be used internally during initialization of the layout. Real uses of the code should go to Column.getPositionInHeading()
        notice that the reports engine might decide for the column to have more rows than the one specified by this function (for filling the heading upto the bottom) - but never less
        Specified by:
        getRowSpanInHeading_internal in class Column<Column>
        Returns:

      • getTrailCells

        public java.util.List<AmountCell> getTrailCells()
        Description copied from class: Column
        Produces a list of trail CellS. These are usually custom made cells that represent some information regarding the Column, that are usually displayed at the bottom of the column. For AmountCellColumnS this is the place to display totals. However, other types of behaviour can be implemented, like error reporting for debugging purposes
        Specified by:
        getTrailCells in class Column<Column>
        Returns:
        the list of trail cells
